Blues.desc: Classic, soulful and emotional music with roots in African-American history.
Blues.fact: The blues influenced the birth of rock and roll.
Blues.tip: Let the rhythm guide your mood.

Blues.desc: Blues often uses a 12-bar chord progression.
Blues.fact: B.B. King is known as the King of Blues.

Blues.desc: Lyrics often express hardship and hope.
Blues.fact: The harmonica is a staple blues instrument.

Blues.desc: Blues scales add a unique flavor to melodies.
Blues.fact: Delta blues came from the Mississippi Delta.
Blues.tip: Try improvising with a blues scale.

Blues.desc: Chicago blues added electric guitar to the mix.
Blues.fact: Muddy Waters helped popularize electric blues.
Blues.tip: Compare acoustic and electric blues styles.

Blues.fact: The term 'blue notes' refers to expressive pitch bends.

Blues.desc: Blues is often performed in small clubs and bars.
Blues.fact: Robert Johnson is a legendary early bluesman.

Blues.desc: Improvisation is central to blues music.
Blues.tip: Jam with friends on a blues progression.

Blues.desc: Blues lyrics often use metaphors and storytelling.
Blues.fact: Women like Ma Rainey were blues pioneers.
Blues.tip: Listen for stories in the lyrics.

Blues.desc: Blues has a slow, swinging groove.
Blues.fact: Blues dancing is a social partner dance.

Classical.desc: Timeless orchestral music with rich harmonies and intricate melodies.
Classical.fact: Classical music can boost concentration and creativity.

Classical.desc: Features composers like Mozart and Beethoven.
Classical.fact: The piano is a central classical instrument.

Classical.desc: Classical pieces are often divided into movements.
Classical.fact: The violin is the star of many concertos.
Classical.tip: Follow the lead instrument in a concerto.

Classical.desc: Classical music includes many eras: Baroque, Romantic, Modern.
Choral music features large vocal ensembles.
Classical.fact: Bach is a master of counterpoint.
Classical.tip: Try singing along with a choir recording.

Classical.desc: Classical music is played by orchestras worldwide.
Classical.fact: Symphonies can last over an hour.

Classical.desc: String quartets are a popular chamber music form.
Classical.fact: Haydn is called the father of the string quartet.

Classical.desc: Classical music is used in many films.
Classical.tip: Watch a ballet performance for the music.

Classical.desc: Many classical pieces are centuries old.
Classical music can be both relaxing and exciting.
Classical.fact: It is often used to teach music theory.

Country.desc: Storytelling with a twang, evoking rural life and heartfelt tales.
Country.fact: Country music often features the banjo and steel guitar.
Nashville is the heart of country music.
Country.tip: Listen for the fiddle and harmonica.

Country.desc: Country has roots in folk and blues.
Country.fact: Johnny Cash is a country legend.
Country.tip: Try singing along to a country ballad.

Country.desc: Modern country blends pop and rock.
Country.fact: Country line dancing is popular at parties.

Country.desc: Country music celebrates love and heartbreak.
Country.fact: Dolly Parton wrote 'Jolene' and 'I Will Always Love You'.
Country.tip: Notice the storytelling in the lyrics.

Country.desc: Country artists often wear cowboy hats.
Country.fact: The Grand Ole Opry is a famous country venue.

Country.desc: Bluegrass is a fast-paced country style.
Country.fact: Banjo picking is a bluegrass hallmark.
Country.tip: Try picking out the banjo in a song.

Country.fact: Willie Nelson is known for his unique voice.

Country.desc: Country music festivals are held worldwide.
Country.fact: Taylor Swift started as a country artist.

Country.desc: The steel guitar gives country its signature sound.
Country.fact: Loretta Lynn is the 'Coal Miner's Daughter'.

Disco.desc: Danceable grooves, funky basslines, and shimmering synths.
Disco.fact: Disco became a global phenomenon in the 1970s.

Disco.desc: Disco clubs featured light-up dance floors.
Disco.fact: Donna Summer is the Queen of Disco.
Disco.tip: Try dancing to a classic disco beat.

Disco.fact: The Bee Gees wrote many disco hits.

Disco.desc: Disco fashion includes glitter and bell-bottoms.
Disco.fact: Saturday Night Fever popularized disco worldwide.
Disco.tip: Watch the movie for iconic dance scenes.

Disco.desc: Disco balls are a dance floor staple.
Disco.fact: Chic's 'Le Freak' is a disco anthem.
Disco.tip: Find the groove in the bassline.

Disco.desc: Disco mixes funk, soul, and pop.
Disco.fact: Gloria Gaynor's 'I Will Survive' is a classic.

Disco.desc: Disco music is energetic and uplifting.
Disco.fact: KC and the Sunshine Band brought disco to the mainstream.
Strings and horns add to the disco sound.

Disco.desc: Disco parties are still popular today.
Disco.fact: Disco Demolition Night marked the genre's backlash.

Hip-Hop.desc: Rhythmic beats, poetry, and streetwise storytelling.
Hip-Hop.fact: Hip-hop culture includes rap, DJing, breakdancing, and graffiti.
Hip-Hop.tip: Feel the beat and express yourself.

Hip-Hop.desc: Hip-hop started in the Bronx, NYC.
Hip-Hop.fact: DJ Kool Herc is a hip-hop pioneer.
Hip-Hop.tip: Try writing your own rap verse.

Hip-Hop.desc: Freestyle rapping is a key hip-hop skill.

Hip-Hop.fact: Sampling is a creative hip-hop technique.
Hip-Hop.tip: Identify samples in your favorite tracks.

Hip-Hop.desc: Graffiti art is part of hip-hop culture.

Hip-Hop.tip: Notice the style in music videos.

Hip-Hop.desc: Rap battles are a hip-hop tradition.
Hip-Hop.fact: Eminem is known for his battle rap skills.
Hip-Hop.tip: Try a friendly rap battle with friends.

Hip-Hop.desc: Hip-hop addresses social and political issues.
Hip-Hop.fact: Tupac and Biggie are legendary rappers.
Hip-Hop.tip: Listen for messages in the lyrics.

Hip-Hop.fact: Crumping and popping are hip-hop dances.
Drake and Kendrick Lamar are chart-toppers.
Hip-Hop.tip: Explore new school and old school hip-hop.

Jazz.desc: Improvisational, expressive, and smooth with rich harmonies.
Jazz.fact: Jazz originated in New Orleans in the early 20th century.
Louis Armstrong is a jazz icon.

Jazz.tip: Notice the solos in each piece.

Jazz.fact: Ella Fitzgerald was the Queen of Jazz.
Jazz.tip: Try scatting along with the vocals.

Jazz.desc: Jazz can be fast or slow.
Jazz.fact: Duke Ellington led a famous big band.
Montreux is a famous jazz festival.

Jazz.desc: Jazz has roots in blues and ragtime.
Jazz is featured in many films.
Jazz.fact: La La Land celebrates jazz music.
Thelonious Monk was a jazz pianist.

Metal.desc: Loud, energetic, and powerful with electric guitars and strong vocals.
Metal.fact: Metal has many subgenres, from thrash to symphonic.

Metal.desc: Heavy metal emerged in the late 1960s.
Metal.fact: Black Sabbath is a pioneering metal band.

Metal.desc: Metal vocals can be clean or growled.
Metal.fact: Iron Maiden is known for melodic metal.

Metal.desc: Metal drumming is fast and complex.
Metal.fact: Double bass pedals are common in metal.
Metal.tip: Pay attention to the drum patterns.

Metal.fact: Metallica is one of the best-selling bands.

Metal.desc: Guitar solos are a metal highlight.
Metal.fact: Eddie Van Halen was a guitar virtuoso.

Metal.tip: Hear the blend of metal and classical.

Metal.desc: Metal fashion is bold and edgy.
Metal.fact: Leather jackets and spikes are common.
Wacken Open Air is a famous metal fest.

Pop.desc: Catchy melodies and universal appeal, always evolving with trends.
Pop stars often set fashion trends.
Pop.fact: Michael Jackson is the King of Pop.
Pop.tip: Try learning a pop dance routine.

Pop.desc: Pop songs are usually 3-4 minutes long.
Pop.fact: Synthesizers are common in pop music.
Taylor Swift blends pop and country.
Pop.tip: Notice how genres mix in pop.

Pop.fact: BeyoncÃ© is known for her live performances.

Pop.desc: Pop lyrics are often about love and life.
Pop.fact: Ariana Grande is a pop superstar.

Pop.desc: Pop music videos are creative and bold.
Pop.fact: Lady Gaga is famous for her visuals.
Pop.tip: Check out the latest music videos.

Pop.desc: Pop is influenced by many genres.
Pop.fact: Ed Sheeran writes and performs pop hits.
Pop is the most streamed genre.

Reggae.desc: Laid-back rhythms, offbeat accents, and positive vibes.
Reggae.fact: Reggae originated in Jamaica in the late 1960s.

Reggae.desc: Reggae uses a one-drop drum beat.
Reggae.fact: Bob Marley is the King of Reggae.
Reggae.tip: Listen for the offbeat guitar strum.

Reggae.desc: Reggae lyrics promote peace and love.
Reggae.fact: Rastafarian culture is linked to reggae.

Reggae.desc: Reggae has influenced hip-hop and pop.
Reggae.fact: Dub reggae uses lots of effects.
Reggae.tip: Hear the echo and reverb in dub.

Reggae.fact: Reggae Sumfest is a major festival.
Toots and the Maytals coined the term 'reggae'.
Reggae.tip: Chill out to a reggae playlist.

Reggae.desc: Reggae bands use horns and keyboards.
Reggae.fact: Steel Pulse is a famous UK reggae band.
Reggae.tip: Listen for brass in the music.

Reggae.desc: Reggae is known for its groove.
Reggae.fact: Peter Tosh was a member of The Wailers.
Reggae.tip: Feel the rhythm of the bass.

Reggae.fact: Many reggae songs are about freedom.
Reggae is a UNESCO cultural heritage.

Rock.desc: Bold, energetic, and rebellious with electric guitars and drums.
Rock.fact: Rock music shaped youth culture worldwide.

Rock.desc: Rock bands often have a lead guitarist.
Rock.tip: Sing along to a classic rock song.

Rock.desc: Rock concerts are loud and lively.
Rock.fact: Queen is known for arena rock anthems.

Rock.desc: Rock has many subgenres: punk, indie, alt, and more.
Rock.fact: Nirvana brought grunge to the mainstream.

Rock.desc: Rock lyrics can be rebellious or poetic.
Rock.fact: Led Zeppelin is a legendary rock band.
Phil Collins is a famous rock drummer.
Rock.tip: Pay attention to the drum fills.

Rock.fact: Leather jackets and jeans are classic.
Rock.tip: Notice the stage outfits at concerts.

Rock.fact: Woodstock was a historic rock festival.

Rock.desc: Rock is about attitude and energy.
Rock.fact: AC/DC is known for high-voltage rock.
Rock.tip: Feel the energy in the music.

Rock.fact: Arctic Monkeys are modern rock icons.
